comment._content: Soissons was the site of a huge battle late in the war, but this is most likely from a much smaller battle in 1914. A contemporary account (note the reference to "Turcos" and "darkfellows" for the Algerian troops): paperspast.natlib.govt.nz/cgi-bin/paperspast?a=d&d=ME... (Marlborough Express, September 19, 1914) "During the Crimean War the Algerian tirailleurs acquired the nickname of "Turcos" (Turks) by which they were widely known over the next hundred years. The name reportedly arose from comparisons between the Algerian troops and the Turkish allies serving alongside the French and British forces at the siege of Sebastopol." en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tirailleur
